page.title: 11Changing Landscove
page.content: Mr. Warren helped us discover how life had changed here since 1926 when he came to the area to farm at Newtake,Staverton.There were some 30 {farms}of various sizes then and each farm employed from 10 to 25 men.The average wage was about Â£2 plus 'perks' They lived in{cottages}that seem to have gone now,and on the farms themselves.They were mostly hard-working contented men who considered themselves so much better off than the men in mines and factories.We can see now why there is so much unemployment today as the farm machines are so good at doing the men's work. The{roads}here were often almost overgrown in the summer and muddy and pitted in the winter.
